snippet: The bookstore chain’s quarterly profit widely missed analysts’ estimates as it paid more tax and invested in its college books business ahead of its planned spinoff.
abstract: Barnes & Nobles reports quarterly net income of $72.2 million, or 93 cents per share, down 14 percent from year-earlier period; results fall far short of analyst expectations.
lead_paragraph: The bookstore chain’s quarterly profit widely missed analysts’ estimates as it paid more tax and invested in its college books business ahead of its planned spinoff.

headline.print_headline: Barnes & Noble Profit Up, but Misses Expectations
headline.main: Barnes & Noble Profit Up, but Misses Expectations
